author: josipa majic
title: REVUTO - Subscription Management
description: Subscription management via Revuto Virtual Debit Cards supporting Cardano. For more please click: https://bit.ly/revuto_cardano

assessments.note: Revuto proposes a very engaging dApp solving a real-world problem with an introduction to Cardano.
Given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully

As more content in the world is moving to subscription-based payments, a simple tool for controlling and managing payments quickly becomes a demand for consumers. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge plus a few attractive benefits in the form of cashback rewards, liquidity yield and virtual debit cards to promote crypto adoption.
The proposal is for a subscriptions dApp however its lacking the basic documentation, project plan and a detailed roadmap needed to effectively address the challenge.
a subscriptions management app is in my opinion a weak decentralization use case. the proposal is also incomplete with no way to vet the current development progress.
this proposal very innovatively provides solution for the Digital shared economy. the technology created by this dapp can be leveraged in future to share unused part of digital consumables.
Yes, the Revuto team seems to have very experienced team behind the project with reasonable roadmap goals.
The timeline is detailed, realistic and with clearly market dependencies.
The team has an in-depth background in fintech and AI, which I believe are competent perks required to deliver the proposal.

There is no technical documentation to assess this dApp's business model, no project roadmap and very high level metrics. There is no developer resource with the skill to create Cardano Plutus smart contracts identified.

the team behind this proposal is having a token sale for their platform that's been in development for over a year, yet the proposer fails to include examples of the app's progress, Github repo links we could use to follow or metrics to gauge how they have developed overtime.
team seems to have done good amount of research and have already started working on the project which makes it highly likely to be implemented successfully.
The proposal is very clear and resourceful. Also, they provided sufficient materials and evidence proving that they will execute on time. The project has traction.
The team listed is consisted of seasoned professionals that are able to deliver the product in a time and cost efficient manner.

The proposal so far is detailed enough to give a clear understanding of the proposal's mission and vision. I will be following this proposal to be on the look out for new updates and progress, so I could get more information on the project to provide solid feedback.

The proposal is lacking the technical documentation required for the requested amount. It's not clear who will develop this idea as a Plutus dApp or the development roadmap a CA may use to track its development.

this proposal is lacking a lot of the technical documentation and its not clear how this would even be a viable project if it was not IOHK backed. Also going back to my first comment, the use case for subscriptions/subscription based micro lending onchain seems niche at best.

The proposal do provide adequate information to asses the feasibility but as it demands almost 1/3 of the available budget for dapp it doesn't come under immediately required dapp. but would love to see this same proposal in next round of funding if it doesn't get accepted.

solution: Subscription management solution: allowing users to actively manage subscription seasonality and enjoy a one click subscription experience.
experience: CTO ex head of AI at Intuit, CEO founder and CEO of emotional analytics firm working for global banks, COO crypto investor and founder
